definition: first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°

sentences.english: The method can be used for controlling the quality of the micro-porphyrizaed granula .
sentences.chinese: 該方法準確，可靠，可用於控制鱉甲山楂顆粒的質量。

sentences.english: Objective To screen the active constituent from Carapax Trionycis.
sentences.chinese: 目的篩選鱉甲抗肝纖維化的活性組分。

sentences.english: Vinegar turtle, a processed product using the stir-baking in sand with hot vinegar quenched.
sentences.chinese: 醋鱉甲，是採用砂燙醋淬的方法得到的生鱉甲炮製品。

sentences.english: Vinegar turtle, a processed product using the stir-baking in sand with hot vinegar quenched.
sentences.chinese: 醋鱉甲，是採用砂燙醋淬的方法得到的生鱉甲炮製品。

definition: liquorice (Sophora flavescens), with roots used in TCM
eight-treasure decoction, tonic formula used in Chinese medicine
milk vetch/plant genus Astragalus/huangqi 黃芪|黄芪, Astragalus membranaceus (used in TCM)
dwarf lilyturf (Ophiopogon japonicus), its tuber used in TCM
dodder (Cuscuta sinensis, a parasitic vine with seeds used in medicine)
mole cricket/Gryllolaptaptidae, family of burrowing insects of order Orthoptera (a serious agricultural pest)
dried fruit of immature citron or trifoliate orange (used in TCM)
